thread.title: Improved quickness gives Dreidger early results
thread.title_full: Improved quickness gives Dreidger early results

title: Improved quickness gives Dreidger early results
text:
Improved quickness gives Dreidger early results 
By wbng sports October 12, 2015 Updated Oct 12, 2015 at 11:45 PM EDT 
Binghamton, NY (WBNG Binghamton) Chris Dreidger is the owner of a fun but definitely-not-sustainable stat: in 10 AHL games, the B-Sens goalie is 7-0. One of those wins came on a 32-save effort in the B-Sens' 2015-16 season opening win. 
His only goal allowed in that game came when a rogue puck deflected off his teammate Fredrik Claesson's skate. Other than that , Dreidger smothered everything the Devils sent his way. 
Dreidger says in the offseason he worked on his reflexes and being quicker between the pipes. 
It might be just one game but so far, so good. 
"I think that's why keeping your eyes on the puck and tracking it well always results in good rebound control," Dreidger said after the game. "So, that looked like it looked good but, then again, when your D do a good job on shots from the outside, it's pretty easy to do that." 
Luke Richardson said Dreidger is likely to be his first choice for the near-future in net, so that makes him a good bet to start Saturday at Syracuse.
